fields.description:
Are going to monochrome era? In windows 3.11 we had black and while, and generation wanted colorful UI. Please bring back colors to icons. ST is so ugly now, so Mac-ish. Please supply next version with "old" icons and create an option in general tab to enable colors.

Or better create skinning option like in chip chat, I would love to have dark skin with colorful icons. The brain remembers better and recognizes faster when there are colors in addition to shapes and text labels. 

Thank you
fields.summary: Bring back colorful UI - SorceTree skins or option

fields.description:
Here is the action I made:
* Clone/New
* Browse hosted project
* Error on login !image-2016-04-21-18-03-32-671.png|thumbnail! 
* Edit Accounts... !image-2016-04-21-18-03-51-212.png|thumbnail! 
* Select my account
* EDIT button

Then the crash.
fields.summary: Crash on Edit of BitBucket account

fields.description: While cloning a MadCap Flare project for technical writing purposes, SourceTree crashed. It appears to have crashed after cloning the project though.
fields.summary: Crashed while cloning a project

fields.description:
When clicking 'create pull request' on a branch in sourcetree, it crashes. Not clear why?
Please let me know what to do, maybe I'm missing some configuration of this sourcetree version?
Thanks, mkoning@travix.com

fields.summary: Crash when doing pull request

fields.description:
I was on a repository from https://github.com/furore-fhir/spark.git, branch dstu2/develop.
Then I hit the 'Terminal' button in the main buttonbar.
Crash.
Restarted, same action, crash again.
fields.summary: Crash when opening Terminal

fields.description:
git init; git lfs install; git lfs track "*.zip"; create foo.zip; git add .

Then I open SourceTree to look at foo.zip. I see it in staged files. I click on it and see the lfs pointer. Then the file unexpectedly looses focus and no files are selected. I expect the file to hold focus so I can study the LFS pointer. 

When I opened SourceTree I was prompted to use the Embedded Git and I said yes. I was then prompted to use some type of Embedded LFS and I said yes.
fields.summary: Selected LFS staged file looses focus

fields.description:
Bug Reproduction Instructions

- Start with a clean workspace
- Modify one file
- Stage the file
- Make another modification to the file
- Select the staged file so that the staged changes show up in the right column
- Mark the checkbox for the unstaged file without selecting it.
- Right column goes blank and the staged file is still selected
    - no way to show the changes in the right column of the staged file without unstaging the entire file or making some other modification to the workspace
fields.summary: User Interface bug causes a staged file to not be selectable

fields.description:
* Had SourceTree open.
* Had a WPF app open from the debugger of Visual Studio 2013 Professional.
* Opened Christian Mosers WPF Inspector app.
* My app wasn't appearing in the WPF inspector list, so I double-clicked the empty area, which told it to attach itself to the SourceTree process.
* SourceTree crashed.

You probably don't want folks attaching development tools to it, but I thought you might at least would want to see the log file (attached).
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when attaching WPF Inspector to it

fields.description:
Add a new feature, which allows to sorting unstaged files by some criteria: file name, date, file type etc.
It will hugely help developers to find required files to commit.
fields.summary: Add sorting unstaged files by criteria(date,name,file type)

fields.description: Opening a submodule during commit, because submodule has uncommitted changes made sourcetree crashing ...
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed during commit and change to submodule

fields.description: If I have staged and unstaged changes and I click Stash and click the Keep Staged Changes checkbox, the stash still includes the staged changes. It was not like this before the major UI update and not what I would expect to happen.
fields.summary: Using Stash with Keep Staged Changes will still include staged changes

fields.description: When dragging a folder from windows explorer in some cases the created bookmark cannot be renamed. This seems to only happen if the bookmark is added at the end of the list (see image). Moving the bookmark to a folder higher in the list allows renaming.
fields.summary: Dragging repository from windows explorer leads to bookmark that cannot be renamed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create commit with any message
2. Start "Repository->Interactive Rebase..."
3. Change message of the commit to russian "тест"
4. Apply changes
5. There is "????" instead of "тест" in commit's description field
fields.summary: All non-english letters become '?' after 'Edit message' in Interactive Rebase

fields.description:
In the history browser, select a changeset with multiple files.
In the changeset, select any file other than the first.
After a couple of seconds, SourceTree will reset the selected file to the first in the list.

The end result is that SourceTree is completely useless for trying to look at changes in a repository.
fields.summary: Impossible to inspect changesets in SourceTree

fields.description: When user have a lot of repositories active, their pages (at the top) show scroll bar, which is ugly and inconvenient. Better to use multiline tabs, or dropdown list for items that could not be displayed, whatever.
fields.summary: Change page control look and feel on multiple repositories

fields.description:
Fetch works as normal, but PULL does not:
{code}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false svn rebase
There is no tracking information for the current branch.
Please specify which branch you want to rebase against.
See git-rebase(1) for details
git rebase <branch>
If you wish to set tracking information for this branch you can do so with:
git branch --set-upstream-to=<remote>/<branch> master
rebase refs/remotes/origin/trunk: command returned error: 1
Completed with errors, see above.
{code}
fields.summary: GIT pull not working for remote SVN repositories.

fields.description:
*To Reproduce*
{code}
try having multiple repositories, multiple tabs (10), one of them connects to a separate (http, different git/stash) stash git. others use ssh
 without using, or activating the http tab, change the password (externally) for it, continue to use the other ssh repository ... close source tree, open multiple times, never use the http tab

do you ever get a pop up?

I had this happening for 4+ months
{code}


see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4094
fields.summary: Source tree locks accounts silently

fields.description: Past two days doing remote pull causes Win 7 rotating wait circle cursor; unable to do CTRL-ALT-DEL or to pull up task monitor. Only remedy was to pull out PC plug. Happened three times. Other times, pull works ok.
fields.summary: SourceTree

fields.description: See attachment.  No way to reproduce, minimizing, maximizing, re sizing did not fix it, but restarting SourceTree DID fix it.
fields.summary: Main toolbar lost it's icon text (and icons are offset)

fields.description:
When you get removed from a repository access, and if you had it configured in Sourcetree, the program keeps asking for your account password, deleting any previous successful login and password save.
This issue gets easily solved by deleting the repository with no access, but it's annoying and takes a while to find out the cause of the frequent password asking.
fields.summary: When access to a repository is removed, Sourcetree keeps asking the password

fields.description:
While git supports working offline, SourceTree doesn't seem to support a common enterprise setup where the user's home folder is on a network drive. When I take my company laptop outside of the office, SourceTree is completely unusable because some info about the repos are stored on the (now unavailable) network drive. I can't even commit locally.

Perhaps the location for these files should be configurable? Or it can be solved in some other way?
fields.summary: No SourceTree when "user home" is unavailable

fields.description: The checkbox for "Check default remotes for updates every X minutes" is not styled the same as the other checkboxes. It appears to not be bolded.
fields.summary: Un-bolded checkbox

fields.description:
When exporting a patch from one repo and importing it into another (in a different branch), I have to almost always use the command line and add {{--ignore-whitespace}} for it to apply. This is after performing a dry-run and having that succeed.

This is extremely frustrating as it just breaks the flow/process of using the UI and coding. Always I have this intermediate interruption of going to Windows Explorer, finding the repo, opening the shell, etc.

It would be great to beef up the Apply Patch dialog to support the ability to ignore whitespace.
fields.summary: Provide a way to ignore whitespace when applying a patch

fields.description:
I oftentimes find myself working across clones of the same repository, but in different branches. Once code is working in a branch, I want to commit it locally and then (sometimes) cherrypick that diff over to the other branch.

I currently do this by exporting a patch to disk, but it would be really convenient and much faster to support the clipboard.

For example, instead of having the patch destination be a folder, just have it be the clipboard. And ditto for the patch source - then we'd get super easy sharing of diffs across repos.

This is related to SRCTREE-1564.
fields.summary: Apply patch from clipboard

fields.description: Using the check out in Sourcetree from Bitbucket Server browser, when Sourcetree opens the checkout dialog, it's behind the browser window.   My expectation is that it appears at the top of the Z-Order.
fields.summary: Checking out from Stash, Sourcetree Window pops up behind browser.

fields.description: Please port the already implemented feature of the Mac version (see SRCTREE-738) to the Windows version.
fields.summary: Auto completion for file names

fields.description:
In the new 1.9.0.5 Beta SourceTree will crash when you attempt to change the password for a hosted account.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Open SourceTree
* Open View/Show Hosted Repositories
* Click Edit Accounts
* Select editing an existing account or add a new one.
* tab through the username text box, to activate the_change password_ button
* click the _change password_ button
* Crash

*Workaround*
* Copy the Askpass.exe from the installation _tools_ folder into the installation folder alongside SourceTree.exe
*NB.* This will not affect production builds it is a side effect of the new Squirrel installer used for Betas

*Reason*
* Squirrel effectively expects a single _.exe_ in the installation directory. To support this AskPass.exe was moved to the tools folder and referenced from there for DVCS interactions.
* However the change password option within SourceTree, references AskPass.exe as a library, which it can not now find.
* This was missed in testing due to an incomplete clean of a previous test installation.
fields.summary: Unable to edit passwords for hosted accounts

fields.description:
In a for me typical git repository there are many branches and often multiple branches share the same commit. This makes the otherwise great Log / History view hard to use. The long chains of boxes marking the branches that currently point to the commit make everything hard to read, especially on smaller notebook screens.
It would be very nice if these could be shortened. One idea to half the needed space for these boxes could be to merge the boxes for the local and origin branches if they point to the same commit. 
Here are some other ideas to make this part of the GUI more compact:
* remove the typical atlassian prefixes with small icons (e.g. /bug/)
* shorten long branch names and show them only on mouseover
* show only the first few boxes and the rest on mouseover
fields.summary: Merge branch markers in History view

fields.description: When a directory is tracked, the "Large files detected" is always shown when trying stage files.
fields.summary: "Large files detected" warning shows up even though the files are tracked by Git LFS.

fields.description:
I have been using SourceTree for several months.
Yesterday, the software froze and was unresponsive for over 20 minutes.

I killed the application.
Thereafter, the application will not start. Every time that I start, the "oops" dialog appears.

I uninstalled the application.
After re-installing SourceTree, the error continues to occur.
fields.summary: SourcTree will not start

fields.description: my sourcetree crashed, it always do that, any operator can trigger it.
fields.summary: my sourcetree crashed, it always do that

fields.description: This happens when using the "Rebase children of ... interactively" function. I would guess all non-ASCII characters (at least German Umlauts) in the commit message are being replaced with question marks.
fields.summary: Missing Unicode support in commit messages when rebasing interactively

fields.description:
I use Search Filter on File Status tab to find files with a particular string in file names/path. This feature used to work fine in previous versions, but after upgrade it throws error each time I try use search. 
I am using SourceTree version 1.8.3.0 on Windows 7 Enterprise machine.

Log file has following error:ERROR [2016-04-15 11:22:25,056] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at SourceTree.View.Container.WorkingCopySplitFileListContainerView.DelayedSearchInvoke(String textWhenQueued) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-

prod\SourceTree.Ui.FileListContainer.Split.Wpf\View\Container\WorkingCopySplitFileListContainerView.xaml.cs:line 153
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherTimer.FireTick(Object unused)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: SourceTree Windows - Crashes while using search filter in File Status tab

fields.description:
Hi guys,

Very sorry if this is not the appropriate area for this topic.

I have a request: I have SourceTree all the time but am not always using it.  It makes sense to keep it open rather than opening it for each individual time.  This solution comes with the burden of the program staying in the Windows Taskbar.  Would it be possible to minimize the program to the tray thereby removing it from the taskbar?

Again, sorry if this is in the wrong area.

Love the product!
fields.summary: Feature Request - Minimize to Tray

fields.description:
As user I would like to have a filter on the feature branches folders or any folder related to branches. to see only the branches that start or contain an specific string.

For instance using the attached image it shows the branches that I have and I would like to filter that to only display the branches that start with CAP-
fields.summary: Filter for Remotes-Origin-Features branches

fields.description:
When you create a new branch, the name of the branch is validated and normalized to convert all white spaces to underscores.
However when you rename an existing branch, and your branch name contains white spaces, the renaming fails with "Invalid branch name". You have to manually fix all the white spaces and replace them with underscores.
fields.summary: Branch name is not validated when renaming branch.

fields.description:
Hi, 

Few days ago, I moved a repository in an other directory. Then, when I started sourceTree and selected the repo, it asked me to change the repo's source directory. I selected the good one but it didn't work. I mean, it goes on asking me to select the repo's source directory. I had to close SourceTree and re-open it so that the modification are applied. 

thanks for the fix,

Paul
fields.summary: Change Directory for moved repository doesn't work

fields.description:
Issue with connecting to Pantheon servers (*occurs using built in git or system git) 

This workaround https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/trust-a-server-s-host-key-when-no-button-is-available-to-trust-it-788731545.html?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Fsourcetreekb%2Ftrust-a-server-s-host-key-when-no-button-is-available-to-trust-it-788731545.html&application=cac
 does not work, because there is no prompt:

See screenshot attached for prompt message.
fields.summary: No prompt from Sourcetree to accept RSA fingerprint

fields.description:
Our project has (unfortunately) some files with not english names. Like "dlgBogenzähler.vb".

It appears (with bogus filename) in the "Unstaged files" list as "changed", but the preview doesn't show anything.
When trying to stage the file, I'm getting a fatal error.

{code}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- Fagus.PresentationLayer.Finishing/SheetProduction/Dialogs/dlgBogenzĂ¤hler.vb
fatal: pathspec 'Fagus.PresentationLayer.Finishing/SheetProduction/Dialogs/dlgBogenzÄ‚Â¤hler.vb' did not match any files
{code}
fields.summary: Unicode in filename makes the file impossible to stage

fields.description:
The Discard Changes window appears to allow some form of staging/unstaging of changes. It's inconsistent in that while it allows you to stage/unstage hunks:

 !image-2016-04-13-10-07-10-730.png|thumbnail! 

.. it doesn't allow you to stage/unstage individual files, but does allow you to stage/unstage _all_ files (note the disabled checkbox for the file but enabled checkbox for "Unstaged files"):

 !image-2016-04-13-10-07-43-723.png|thumbnail! 

Clicking the "Unstaged Files" checkbox will stage all of the files and then close the Discard Changes window. Staging changes doesn't actually show them in the "staged files" section either.

Additionally, there is an unlabelled checkbox above the list of staged files next to the sorting options:

 !image-2016-04-13-10-06-30-021.png|thumbnail! 

I find it weird that the Discard Changes window allows staging/unstaging in the first place. Since changes can be discarded individually from the File Status view anyway, it would make more sense if the Discard button merely offered the Reset All operation.
fields.summary: Discard Changes window staging/unstaging is weird and inconsistent

fields.description:
Add repository status if connection fails:
for now only diff comits counters are showned, maybe add a colour status to show that git server can't be reached
fields.summary: Add repository status if connection fails

fields.description: It would we great to add filters on repository list panel (by name)
fields.summary: Add repository list filters
when i post my data to server, it was crashed

fields.description:
I frequently get the error message like the following
'code 128: fatal: Could not change back to 'C:/Users/scrandle/.gitconfig/remote-junit-testing': No such file or directory'

The git repository 'remote-junit-testing' is not located in the folder suggested by the error above. Instead the cloned git repository is located at 'C:/Users/scrandle/git/remote-junit-testing'

The error seems to come and go every five minutes or so.

Also when this issue is occurring, I am unable to read settings in my .gitconfig file. 

See attached files
fields.summary: SourceTree frequent 'code 128: fatal' error and crash
Clicking Close after issues in interactive rebase seems to make a "git rebase --abort" instead of letting me fix issues to continue

fields.description: I have projects with the same name, but in different folders (e.g. one in "source" and one in "deploy"), and I'd like to be able to see the full path to the root directory of the project when I mouse over open project tabs. It would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Allow ST to use same name in different projects

fields.description:
Allow the branch name in the commit flow to be selectable copyable.

We encourage to use the jira ticket number for the branch and also with the commit message so that when the branch is merged and deleted, the commit mesaage has the information. It would be easier to copy paste the ticket number from the branch name if it is selectable. 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Allow the branch name in the commit flow to be selectable copyable.

fields.description:
I'm trying out SourceTree, previously used TortoiseHg.

I love SourceTree in terms of how nice the UI is, but one thing I noticed is on the commit map if you close a branch, the icon looks the same as a regular commit, whereas in TortoiseHg it uses a different graphic to help illustrate this difference better.

Be nice if SourceTree could follow in the same direction.
fields.summary: Use a new symbol to illustrate a closed branch.

fields.description: Add history filtering similar to one present in Jetbrains WebStorm where user can click on 'filter by path' drop-down and select what folder to show in the Log. This is awesome functionality for monolithic repositories.
fields.summary: Log History by Path

fields.description:
Although SourceTree does have quick-diff for any selected file in Log/History, having the option to start external diff tool from the action in the context menu and show entire content/changes of the files is something I believe would be beneficial.

As a workaround, one can use CTRL + D keyboard shortcut.
fields.summary: Add External Diff action on Log/History Context (right click) Menu for files

fields.description: Improve UX by allowing users to define actions available on the toolbar of the application.
fields.summary: Editable Toolbar

fields.description: Users cannot complete installing SourceTree but they get stuck in account settings. See also the attached. It happens on any version of SourceTree WIN and MAC.
fields.summary: Cannot complete the installation but get stuck in account setting

fields.description: I want to be able to uncheck this option at install time by setting the value of  "GitCommitMergedChangesImmediately" to 'False' in the 'SourceTree.exe.config' file immediately after installation. Even if I change the setting after installation manually SourceTree ignores it! I can do this with the "Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible" setting! I don't want developers to have to remember to uncheck this setting, and it has to be unchecked for our development process. It's not even sticky, as is suggested in  SRCTREE-1384 - Make "commit merged changes immediately" checkbox sticky. We are currently using version 1.6.23, but I have checked the latest version - 1.8.2.11 and the behaviour is the same (sad).
fields.summary: Please make the "commit merged changes immediately" checkbox agree with the setting in the config files!

fields.description:
It would be nice if you could hide specific branches and tags from the graph view.
In projects with many branches the graph can get quite messy.
fields.summary: Hide commits from graph view

fields.description:
When I pull changes from a localization file, SourceTree corrupts the file and adds random unicode characters that show up as chinese and other random garbage. Git assumes the file is unchanged even though it is different from the remote version; the remote version is unaffected by this corruption.

{{਍ऀऀ⼀⼀ 唀䤀 猀琀甀昀昀ഀഀ
        "MOM_Jump"    "JUMP"
਍ऀऀ∀䴀伀䴀开䐀甀挀欀∀ ∀䐀唀䌀䬀∀ഀഀ}}
should be
{{		// UI stuff
		"MOM_Jump"	"JUMP"
		"MOM_Duck" "DUCK"}}
This only happens to a user who pulls and rebases from the commit that changed the text file, the user who committed is not affected. 
The localization files in question are text files used to localize strings in the program.
fields.summary: Localization text files corrupted when pulling/rebasing

fields.description:
I accidentally clicked the add all button. Luckily this happened and I was mostly done with resolving conflicts, otherwise I would have most likely needed to restart the merge that I have been working on for the last 3 days. 

It should warn you, or prevent you from adding files that have a conflict.
fields.summary: Sourcetree should have a setting that prevents you from adding conflicted files during a merge

fields.description: When I attempt to restart the merge it does nothing
fields.summary: Unable to restart merge in sourcetree

fields.description:
Sometimes, after making changes to files on submodules, the changes to not appear anywhere. In fact, no files appear in the window even if I change the settings to view all files. Usually, if I close and re-open SourceTree, the files reappear. However, the last time it did not,

Refreshing (either from the menu or by hitting F5) does not solve the issue. 

When I go to the Log / History view, I can see the files (I thought previous times I did not, so this may not be consistent).

I attached three screenshots to illustrate.

(After taking the screenshots I tried to close and re-open SourceTree again, and this time the files DID get updated. See Bug4.png)
fields.summary: Submodule repositories do not always refresh when chnages has been made.

fields.description: System can't find repository... fatal.
fields.summary: Crash on upgrade.

fields.description:
Having installed SourceTree and then upgraded it a few times, Programs and Features shows several installed versions rather than just one.

 !image-2016-04-11-09-32-41-100.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Upgrading SourceTree leaves multiple versions in Programs and Features

fields.description:
I have been trying to split & manage development of our local code modules with the git submodules & subtree features ... but in the end both of them did have major drawbacks and added way to much overhead to the general git workflow and maintaining of the version control itself.

A good effort to solve the issues & drawbacks that come with using submodules and git subtree has been made by git-subrepo (https://github.com/ingydotnet/git-subrepo) and I am starting to use it more and more for the benefit of avoiding the drawbacks of the other two mentioned subrepo methods.

Would there be a way to integrate the CLI features of git-subrepo into SourceTree ? either via adding some extensibility API and letting the open source community implement the integration of the git-subrepo workflow or via an integrated support for this kind of subrepo workflow ?

Thanks & Regards,
Wolfgang
fields.summary: Support for git-subrepo

fields.description: attempted to commit project, but it showed a submodule was changed. I clicked on open... and the app crashed
fields.summary: Open submodule when shown to be altered caused crash

fields.description:
Regular expressions don't work for me in SourceTree 1.8.3.0 on Windows. I tried even the simplest example for replacing (.*) with word 'test' and it didn't replace anything.
Under Mac OS it works fine.

I've attached screenshots that reflect the problem.
fields.summary: Regular expression in commit text links don't work.

fields.description:
Source Tree does not allow you to view the diff between a .SQL file, even though the file contents are just plain text.  This problem is extended online to stash as well.

Under the hood, this is likely an issue with git / sql server management studio, but it's manifested in Source Tree and could be handled much better.

According to the following questions:

* [Can SourceTree handle mixed UTF-16/Ansi file formats?|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/161574/]
* [File comparison displays the message "This file cannot be rendered in your browser" but source view works fine|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/11443419/]

This occurs because:

{quote}SQL files contain a [Byte Order Mark (BOM)|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byte_order_mark], this is the {{0xFEFF}} sequence you're seeing at the start of the file.  Unfortunately these bytes means git treats the file as _binary_, not _text_, and so any operations that depend on git, such as generating a diff, aren't going to return what you expect.{quote}

But this is something that SourceTree is minimally doing a bad job at representing this error.  Also almost any other external diff tool has no problem comparing the two files, so it's within reason that Source Tree could handle it.  Also, on BitBucket Server, there's the option to [Transcode Diffs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-diff-transcoding-in-bitbucket-server-776640069.html].

Even a guide on how to setup diffs between sql files would certainly help a non-trivial amount of people


I attached two very simple SQL files, one created by SSMS and another from Notepad.  SSMS encodes UCS-2 LE BOM, while Notepad encodes as ANSI.

Another strategy might be to setup a [commit trigger or filter to remove the BOM|http://stackoverflow.com/q/31443291/1366033]
fields.summary: SourceTree diff treats .sql files as binary

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"File Status" string is sometimes displayed instead of the branch/tag name for some operations.
This has been observed occurring when renaming a branch, deleting a branch or deleting tags.
It seems to happen when many operations occur within close time proximity of each other.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Scenario with tags deletion
# Create a lot of tags
# Delete one after the other very fast

Scenario with branch deletion
# Go to a repository with 2 branches, e.g. master, develop
# Checkout branch develop
# Before the check-out completes, right-click master branch and select to delete it


h3. Expected Results
The tag or branch name, where the operation is performed should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The string 'File Status' is displayed instead of the branch/tag name sometimes:
 !image-2016-04-08-12-07-51-012.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2016-04-14 at 13.16.10.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "File Status" string is sometimes displayed instead of the branch/tag name for some operations

fields.description: Source Tree crashes whenever I attempt to access the terminal.
fields.summary: Crashes when opening terminal every time

Framework Version: v4.0.30319

   at Microsoft.Win32.RegistryKey.SetValue(System.String, System.Object, Microsoft.Win32.RegistryValueKind)
   at SourceTree.AppRoot.RegisterBrowserEmulationModeKey(System.String, System.String, UInt32)
   at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(System.Windows.StartupEventArgs)
   at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(System.Windows.StartupEventArgs)

   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeImpl()

   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)

   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(System.Object, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32, System.Delegate)
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.LegacyInvokeImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority, System.TimeSpan, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.SubclassWndProc(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr)
   at MS.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Interop.MSG ByRef)
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.PushFrameImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherFrame)

fields.description:
Hi,

when I add my changed files in SourceTree the GUI does not get refreshed.
As workaround I always open Preferences and close them again. Then my changes are shown as "staged".

Kind regards 

Andi
fields.summary: No GUI refresh when adding changed files

fields.description:
Since updating from version 1.7.0 to 1.8.3 I am prompted with an error message when trying to complete almost any action, it reads as follows (see screen capture):

{panel:title=Error Message}
'git status' failed with code -1:
System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: The system cannot find the file specified
(C:\Development\AirMaestro)
{panel}

This stops me being able to perform any action within SourceTree.
Upon downgrading to version 1.7.0 I can open the same repository and everything works normally.

As shown in the screen capture manually running git status on the command line returns the expected result with no error.

Running sourcetree as administrator has not resolved the issue.
fields.summary: Program crashes with "The system cannot find the file specified"

fields.description:
Currently you can only stage new files completely.
While git does allow you to stage only parts of even new files.

(A simple workaround is to save the version you want to stage, do it, and revert the change. So not critical, but an odd omission.)
fields.summary: Staging only parts of new files

fields.description:
This is a minor nitpick but has been annoying me for a while.

Can you change the commit message for closing a Mercurial branch from the UI to "Close branch <branch-name>"? This would be more consistent with the phrasing of the default merge commit message.

For example:

The default merge message is *Merge* _(present tense)_
The default close branch message is *Closed branch <branch-name>* _(past tense)_

There's also no way that I can see to manually edit that message when closing a branch from the UI.
fields.summary: Change commit message when closing a Mercurial branch to be consistent with default merge message

fields.description:
When you have a large list of local brunch (or remote), it is inconvenient to move to other blocks.

Current interface - st01.png
Possible interface - st02.png, st03.png
fields.summary: Pin "Branches", "Remotes" and "Stashes" at the branches list

fields.description:
I pressed on the check box to select all file changes and source tree crashed. Log is attached.

Second instance of this crash, I also noticed that it had not updated all the details on the view pane either. There were files missing, but the crash had occurred before I can find out what.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when selecting to add all the files to the change set

fields.description: Perl crashes writing dump in project directory.
fields.summary: perl crashes

fields.description: It has been reported by some users that when updating from SourceTree 1.7 to SourceTree 1.8.3 (using SourceTree's update menu), the application crashes.
fields.summary: Updating SourceTree 1.7 to SourceTree 1.8.3 is crashing for some users

fields.description:
At work, Git server has been moved to a new server, which has ssh libs updated. It seems that Sourcetree is using an outdates version of ssh, which does not connect with the new server.

I have tried to install the last version of putty. When I press pull, nothing happens, I have watched traffic with whireshark.

However, with git bash everything is working as expectec, I copy & paste commands from sourcetree and it works.

Thanks a lot, best regards.
fields.summary: Sourcetree is not connecting with ssh

fields.description:
The only suggestion i could have for your SourceTree application is the ability to minimise tye program to the task tray. Being a non-professional developer, I often dip in and out of projects throughout the day, having to close and open SourceTree multiple times. 

I would prefer to have an option to mimimise the program to the task tray, with potential bonus options for performibg fetch requests with push notifications to windows. 



Thanks,
- Ollie
fields.summary: Minimise to task tray

fields.description:
Hi!

We use standard GitFlow settings on Git repositories.
When another developer pushes changes to "develop" branch, I can't see number of commits I'm back in "develop" or master branch.

Remote status is not refreshed on startup of SourceTree in bookmarked repositories list.
And does not refreshes later in Repositories Tab.

I have set track option for "develop" and "master" branches in "Pull" dialog box.

If I make a "Pull" operation from toolbar, new changes arrives successfully.

This feature worked fine in 1.7.0 version.

This is a very usefull feature to check if there are some changes from other team members.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not refresh number of commits I am back in tracked branch

fields.description:
Hassle to have to stash, pull, apply stash, delete stash.
Could maybe have an option to automate?
fields.summary: Allow pull with local changes

fields.description:
* stage a whole file change in the "File Status" tab
* click on the file in the staged files area and the diff shows up on the right
* select a single line on the right and click "unstage line"
* the diff changes to the line you just unstaged (and anything else in that file that hasn't been staged yet which should be nothing if you originally staged the whole file) however the selection on the left is still on the "staged files" file. This means that if you want to see what is staged in the diff, you need to deselect the staged file (by clicking on a different staged file or an unstaged file) and then re-select the staged file.
fields.summary: Diff-view is different than file selection

fields.description:
Some users have received a 403 error page when trying to log in to their Atlassian account during the SourceTree installation process. A few have identified that the issue occurs when IE security/privacy settings are set to "High".

The SourceTree installer should work regardless of this setting, or not use IE for authentication.
fields.summary: Installer can't authenticate to Atlassian with IE "High" security settings

fields.description: When working on a local clone of Unreal Engine 4 repo (https://github.com/EpicGames/UnrealEngine - it's a private repo, but if you create an account at https://www.unrealengine.com/ you'll have free access to it), SourceTree often become unresponsive for several minutes (and sometimes crash too) making it unusable with that code base. I know that UE4 code base is "huge", but it's too bad to not be able to use SourceTree with it!
fields.summary: Application hangs on huge repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The indicators for Pull in the tollbar are not updated properly

h3. Environment
SourceTree Windows 1.8.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a repo that has two branches, e.g. master and develop in SourceTree
# Checkout *master* branch
# Make a change on the *remote* repo, in master branch
# Do a Fetch in ST
# You'll see an indication on the Pull button in the toolbar
# Switch to *develop* branch in SourceTree
# The indication in Pull still stays there, although there's nothing to pull in develop (Expected behaviour here: not to show indicator at all, since there is nothing to pull from develop branch)
# Now switch back to *master* branch again, the indication in Pull disappears (Expected behaviour: show the indication in Pull icon, since there are still changes to pull)
fields.summary: Indicators for Pull button in toolbar are not displayed properly

fields.description: App throws an error and exists when I select one of the files from the "unstaged files" list and press ctrl + c
fields.summary: app crashes when I press ctrl + c, when unstaged file is selected
Crash when scrolling large number of uncommitted changes (~1000 files)

fields.description: A Crash message appears when i validate my template into the searchbox
fields.summary: Crash when search files

fields.description:
When I do changes in many files and tries to stag all by clicking "Unstaged files" checkbox then it goes to infinite wait indicator. Does not happen anything. 

But when I click on single file to move to stag every files which where in wait state goes to staged files list.
fields.summary: "Staging all files" not working

fields.description: I want to import and export custom actions so I can share them with my team quickly. _(If this feature already exists, please make it easier to find)_
fields.summary: Import/Export Custom Actions

fields.description: When I attempt to open the Terminal, SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Terminal Crashes Source Tree

fields.description:
The way how the left two status bars are organized leave a lot of room unused, that also could be used by the log.

Wat about: combining the bookmarks + repository tree? Think the bookmarks could be at the left bottom, and the active repository tree could start at the left top already. 

We know we could hide the bookmarks, they are useful but not at the right place in our opinion.
fields.summary: Combine bookmarks with repo status

fields.description: In my git project I have changes in the main project and in one submodule. When I press commit, sourcetree first checks all the submodule and correctly detects that my submodule has unsubmitted changes. If I press "Open" the App crashes. I am able to reproduce this behaviour on other projects with this submodule.

fields.description: Everytime I attempt to access the Terminal, Source Tree crashes.
fields.summary: Terminal

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
1) Select a file in the pending status
2) Select a line
3) Hold down shift, and select a line above the selected line

h3. Result:
The first line selected deselects, and the line below it is selected.
fields.summary: Multi-selecting lines in "pending" file diff causes odd selection

fields.description: In the list of changed files, I can right-click and get a menu with options such as External Diff etc. It would be nice if one of the options was 'show original version' which would show me the version without the current changes.
fields.summary: Add menu option to see original version of the file

fields.description:
When making changes to unstaged or staged files via the File Status view (or the bottom part of log/history), the sort order is lost after a change is made.

If I'm scrolling through an alphabetically sorted list and picking out items to exclude, then each time I select an item I have to resort the list (twice if I want A first, since by default it sorts descending first!) 

This is incredibly frustrating, as I hope you understand. You already retain the scroll position, can you please retain the column sort order too?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Please retain sort order when refreshing unstaged/staged file lists

fields.description:
After upgrading SourceTree to the latest version, I receiving the following error when trying to add a new Git repo via https:

The procedure entry point EVP_rc4 could not be located in the dynamic link library LIBEAY32.dll

This occurs directly after entering the Source Path / URL and changing focus to a different field.
fields.summary: Error after upgrading to latest version

fields.description: Please add a button/menu item to preform a fetch for all open tabs at the same time.

Original ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-1264
